sentence.Network_en: He talked to me interminably about his first wife.
sentence.Network_cn: 他没完没了地和我讲他的第一任妻子。

sentence.Network_en: For the same reason, writers talk interminably about their own books.
sentence.Network_cn: 出于同样的原因, 作家没完没了地谈论着他们自己的作品.

list.abs: the audience was bored by the president's interminable speech .主席那冗长的讲话令听众们厌烦。
during this interminable year , he added , all of France was in Verdun .他补充道，在这个漫长的年代，整个法兰西都在凡尔登。
At the end of the queue waits an interminable lift journey ., 排队等候结束后是漫长的电梯之旅.
their quarrels about the trivia are always interminable ., 他们对琐事的争吵总是没完没了.

entry.tran: 无休止的;没完没了的;冗长不堪的
entry.def: If you describe something as interminable, you are emphasizing that it continues for a very long time and indicating that you wish it was shorter or would stop.

means.word_mean: 1. all the time; seemingly without stopping;

sentences.sentence: "a theological student with whom I argued interminably"

auth_sentence.content: From Instantaneous to Eternal by David Labrador The units of time range from the infinitesimally brief to the interminably long.
auth_sentence.res_content: From Instantaneous to Eternal by David Labrador The units of time range from the infinitesimally brief to the interminably long.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: From Instantaneous to Eternal by David Labrador The units of time range from the infinitesimally brief to the interminably long.

auth_sentence.content: "Disposable polystyrene tableware" first appeared in China in the mid-Eighties on its interminably long rail routes.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: "Disposable polystyrene tableware" first appeared in China in the mid-Eighties on its interminably long rail routes.

auth_sentence.content: When he is asked a question, he tends to pause interminably, then answer in a deep, barely audible voice.
